1:
God is our refuge and strength,\q a very present help in trouble.
\q
2:
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change,\q though the mountains should be shaken into the heart of the seas,
\q
3:
though its waters roar and rage, and\q though the mountains tremble with their swelling.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
4:
There is a river whose streams make the city of God happy,\q the holy place where the Most High dwells.
\q
5:
God is in the middle of her; she will not be moved;\q God will help her, and he will do so at the dawn of morning.

\q
6:
The nations raged and the kingdoms were shaken;\q he lifted up his voice, and the earth melted.
\q
7:
Yahweh of hosts is with us;\q the God of Jacob is our refuge.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
8:
Come, behold the deeds of Yahweh,\q the destruction he has caused on earth.
\q
10:
Be quiet and know that I am God;\q I will be exalted among the nations; I will be exalted on the earth.
\q
11:
Yahweh of hosts is with us;\q the God of Jacob is our refuge.
\qs Selah\qs*
